entry.title: A roadmap for evaluating moral competence in large language models
entry.content:
Authors: J Haas, S Bridgers, A Manzini, B Henke, J May... - Nature, 2026

Abstract: The question of whether large language models (LLMs) can exhibit moral capabilities is of growing interest and urgency, as these systems are deployed in sensitive roles such as companionship and medical advising, and will increasingly ...

Tags: Reviewer, Too: Consciousness

entry.title: Evolution of error correction through a need for speed
entry.content:
Authors: R Ravasio, K Husain, CG Evans, R Phillips... - Science, 2026

Abstract: Kinetic proofreading is a class of error-correcting mechanisms in biology that expend energy to avoid mistakes during replication, transcription, and translation. Proofreading is typically assumed to evolve when selection for fidelity outweighs ...

Alert: Jack W. Szostak (author alert)

entry.title: A Large-Scale Computer-Vision Mapping of the Geometric Structures of Stroboscopically-Induced Visual Hallucinations
entry.content:
Authors: E Grove, T Hewitt, AK Seth, F Macpherson... - bioRxiv, 2026

Abstract: Visual hallucinations (VHs) occur across psychedelic states and diverse psychiatric and neurological conditions, yet their phenomenology remains difficult to characterise. Empirical research on VHs is hindered by the lack of large-scale ...
